elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which stakeholder groups are likely to be satisfied with this situation and why?

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Why are shareholders' expectations likely to be fulfilled?
elements.correctAnswer: The shareholders and thus the owners of Bergi AG want to achieve the highest possible profit.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Unfortunately, very few of these tents are sold in the first season. What could be the reason for this?
elements.correctAnswer: The customer target group would like to see lower prices.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Bergi AG is considering selling off the remaining tents and reducing the price by 20%. What consequences would this have for the satisfaction of the stakeholder groups customers, employees, suppliers and the state?
elements.correctAnswer: Customers will be more satisfied because prices will fall. Employees fear for their wages. Suppliers: probably no influence as the invoice has already been paid. State: Profits will fall and with them the expected tax revenue.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Shareholder Fredi suggests doing a media report on the new tents. How could a media report change customers' expectations?
elements.correctAnswer: The media report could raise awareness among customers that Bergi AG is trend-conscious and offers high-quality products.
